name: David Lietjauw
title: APM @ Twitter
bio: APM @ Twitter. I used to be a sweet potato farmer from Kansas. Now, I'm an APM @ Twitter learning how to build with empathy so we can all experience a more inclusive future. You can find me tending to my succulents~
path: Swipe to Unlock (book) - My friend, Neel, wrote this easy to understand primer on how technology and business work together, www.techmeme.com - Reading the technews everyday helps develop product sense by understanding trends in the industry,  https://www.getrevue.co/profile/caseynewton - The Interface is a newsletter focusing on dialogue around social media and consumer tech by The Verge's Casey Newton, https://constine.substack.com/ - Weekly newsletter over startups and new tech trends by TechCrunch's Josh Constine, https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLfAX25ZLrPGRzfILkSd-YiWfsoloCETAe - Bloomberg Technology is a daily 1-hour show where Emily Chang talks about what's going on in tech by interviewing CEOs and talking to experts (I watch this during breakfast everyday!).

journeys.title: ColorStack
journeys.description: My friend Jehron Petty started ColorStack, a non-profit whose mission is to increase the entrance, retention and success of Black, Latinx, and Native American college students in computing. Consider volunteering your time to help the next-gen of diverse tech talent succeed!

name: David Cai
title: APM II @ Yahoo (Verizon Media)
bio: APM @ Yahoo (Verizon Media). APM by day, SWE at heart, filling my free time with running.
path: <https://productsense.carrd.co> - [A card of the news sources I used to develop product sense],<pmtechlessons.com> - [Approachable explainers of tech concepts for non-technical PMs], <http://www.crackingthepminterview.com> - [A classic prep book. I don't really have an allegiance to a particular book, but this is what I used]

journeys.title: PM Tech Lessons
journeys.description: Approachable explainers of tech concepts for non-technical PMs, specifically with an algorithms-focused prep course.

name: Max Beech
title: APM @ Yahoo (Verizon Media)
bio: APM @ Yahoo (Verizon Media), working on emerging ad formats team. Previously: Product @ Revolut (financial startup), Co-Founder @ Intro, Computer Science graduate at Exeter University in the UK. Fun fact: I once won third prize at a talent contest for sticking out my tongue
path: <https://stellarpeers.com/> - [A fantastic community of aspiring and existing PMs who through a series of shared interview practices, made a huge difference to my ability to perform under pressure], <https://www.amazon.co.uk/Cracking-PM-Interview-Product-Technology/dp/0984782818> - [You should definitely read at least one of the popular interview books, but be wary of copy/pasting their formula. Design your own approach to answering questions], <https://apmlist.com/> - [A tried and tested site, APM list gives a comprehensive guide to US-based APM programs. Particularly if you are international, make sure to find local opportunities too]

journeys.title: Today
journeys.description: Doing stuff with no-one there to push you is hard. Today helps you to actually do that side-project you've been putting off and holds you to it thanks to its unique approach of tracking the time you spend on each task. Unique timing. Daily streaks. Eye-candy.

name: Mahmoud Alzaghari

bio: PM @ Redfin. I am a recent Berkeley grad where I studied Cognitive Science and a minor in Computer Science. Prior to Redfin, I was a project manager intern at Cisco, a business development intern at a neurotech startup, and I am a Bay Area local!
path: <https://www.lennyrachitsky.com/p/how-to-get-into-product-management> - [A high level overview of what a PM does, and the paths to get into product], <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0ffLxnKkaJ8&list=PLrtCHHeadkHr8ro-vTg1CAdDuwrVmXS4y> - [A Youtube playlist of product interview tips and mock interviews. I used this resource a lot while I was recruiting for product roles], <https://blog.tryexponent.com/tag/product-management/> - [A collection of product management articles that detail what product management is, how to break in, and how to successfully interview for the roles]

name: Katie Goldstein
title: PM @ Microsoft
bio: PM @ Microsoft. Recent Dartmouth grad from SF. I get excited about pugs, helping others, my Duolingo streak, and Japanese toilets. Let's chat!
path: <https://www.amazon.com/Cracking-PM-Interview-Product-Technology/dp/0984782818> - [Read this book cover to cover to learn more about PMing and prep for PM design questions. I'd recommend you take notes on the different frameworks!], <https://www.linkedin.com/> - [I networked a bunch before starting my role to 1) gain more clarity into the role and company culture and 2) gain useful insights to disseminate during my interviews, and 3) gain referrals.],  <https://www.theverge.com/, https://techcrunch.com/> - [Two great tech news sites that I browse for 5-10 min regularly! Send cool articles to your friends/family/others. Form opinions about things that are happening, and keep track of companies and initiatives that seem interesting.]

path: https://www.amazon.com/Cracking-PM-Interview-Product-Technology/dp/0984782818: My literal manual to life for the semester I was interview prepping! Highly recommend using this over video interviews to practice a diversity of questions.   https://blog.pramp.com/how-to-succeed-in-a-system-design-interview-27b35de0df26: Thinking about scaling infrastructure is super crucial to acing more technical product management interviews. Better understanding how to approach these questions is not a piece of cake, but highly recommend a computer architecture class curriculum as a foundation.

name: Sandra Luo
title: Program Manager @ Microsoft
bio: PM @ Microsoft, working on industry solutions for Microsoft Teams. Passionate about travel, intuitive design, learning people‚Äôs individualities, and leaving the world a lil more open than you found it.
path: 1. Reach out to your network for referrals! Don‚Äôt be shy ‚Äî people usually get referral bonuses if you get hired so they are probably eager to help. Make it easy for them by sending your resume, email address, relevant links, and a casual blurb selling yourself (as if you were in their shoes recommending yourself). Best means of getting your foot in the door is to do this research early and ask your contact to send your resume to the recruiter/hiring manager through their internal means of communication (Slack, company email, etc). This will make your application bubble up rather than getting lost in the application system. 2. https://2by22.blog/definitive-guide-to-behavioral-interview-questions/ A great supplement to Decode and Conquer about acing the behavioral interview questions and leaving an impression with your interviewer. 3. https://www.keyvalues.com/culture-queries End your interview on a strong note by asking the questions that matter to you and show you value culture.

name: Joel Montano
title: PM @ Microsoft
bio: PM @ Microsoft. Currently working at Envision Accelerator, helping underrepresented founders receive the funding and resources they need to set them up for success. I'm also scouting for a venture fund and generally interested in the future of work, gaming, dev tools, no-low code, and the creator economy. Outside of tech, I'm trying to get into hiking and learning Korean (for fun) :).
path: Cracking the Coding Interview [Book on general PM topics], https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjm_qVkCPjOVDz9BWjNqO9A [Great mock videos]
